SENT.plain: An unusual case of moyamoya disease associated with bilateral occlusion of the vertebral artery is reported

This case shows several embryologic collateral channels, which are typical of moyamoya disease, around the brainstem, that is, a transdural anastomosis between the superior cerebellar artery and the posterior meningeal artery, a leptomeningeal anastomosis between the superior cerebellar artery and the posterior inferior cerebellar artery, and moyamoyalike collateral vessels via primitive lateral anastomotic channels of Padget
Bilateral encephalomyosynangiosis (temporal muscle graft) were performed
Postoperatively, no ischemic attacks have developed for 6 years
